page.title: 05 CHEWTON GLEN HOTEL
page.content: The Chewton Glen, one of the leading hotels in the world, was built as a private house in the 1700's on 36 acres of land. Now it has 44 rooms (eleven suites and 33 bedrooms) named after Captain Marryat's books or people in them. This is because Captain Marryat possibly wrote "Children of the New Forest", one of his books, there. In the Oak Room are some priceless books. There are four separate gardens, one of which belongs to the Lady Baker Suite. Altogether the hotel has ninety staff including sixteen cooks. Ninety people can fit into the restaurant which is very nice. Many famous people have stayed there including Noel Edmunds, Terry Wogan, Michael Aspel, Kevin Keegan and President Reagan's son. It could cost Â£100 to stay for one night. By Sarah Jones.
